message: In particular I miss a vertical version of :sbn (split buffer next) - any way to make that work for vertical splits?

The best I've got right now is 
:nmap <leader>vh   :leftabove  vnew<CR>
:nmap <leader>vl  :rightbelow vnew<CR>
which lets me decide on which side I want the new window ... but it opens on a blank buffer instead of an existing one
with +bn it will move to the next buffer. It still leaves the empty buffer around though

I love to vertically split the current window while autocompleting a buffer I may have, see my question (and solution) in StackOverflow http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4571494/open-a-buffer-as-a-vertical-split-in-vim

@alfredodeza thanks! the "vert sb" suggestion gave me what I needed:
:nmap <leader>vh :leftabove vert sbn<CR>
:nmap <leader>vl :rightbelow vert sbn<CR>
that gives me the left/right options that behave like :sbn for horiz split
